item.title: Freedom
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Freedom

Saheeda Nadeem, 65, an undocumented immigrant from Pakistan who was given sanctuary by First Congregational Church in Kalamazoo, Mich., learned this week that she would not be deported, her lawyer said.

nytimes.com

After Three Years in a Church Facing Deportation, ‘Today I Have Freedom’

Saheeda Nadeem, 65, an undocumented immigrant from Pakistan who was given sanctuary by First Congregational Church in Kalamazoo, Mich., learned this week that she would not be deported, her lawyer said.Saheeda Nadeem, 65, an undocumented immigrant from Pakistan who was given sanctuary by First Congregational Church in Kalamazoo, Mich., learned this week that she would not be deported, her lawyer said.

item.title: "Based on multiple conversations with lawyers who work with...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Based on multiple conversations with lawyers who work with asylum seekers at the border and a review of hospital records and legal documents, multiple US citizen newborns were removed to Mexico after their mothers were subject to a Trump-era border ban that the Biden-Harris administration has been slow to rescind [...]

In fiscal year 2020, CBP reported over 200,000 expulsions – including unaccompanied children – were turned back under the Title 42. In the first three months of fiscal year 2021 alone, expulsions have exceeded 190,000, to date. The Trump administration hailed Title 42 as “tremendously effective."

At least 11 migrant women sent to Mexico border towns without birth certificates for newborns since last March

theguardian.com

Revealed: US citizen newborns sent to Mexico under Trump-era border ban

At least 11 migrant women sent to Mexico border towns without birth certificates for newborns since last MarchAt least 11 migrant women sent to Mexico border towns without birth certificates for newborns since last March

item.title: The Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition found in a public...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

The Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition found in a public records request that a DMV fraud investigations unit helped ICE identify, surveil and detain individuals without warrants.

The subsequent arrests affected hundreds of families.

Public records show a DMV fraud investigations unit helped ICE identify, surveil and detain individuals without warrants.

cpr.org

Immigration Advocates Say DMV Shared Data With ICE That Led To Arrests. Colorado Lawmakers Don’t Want It To Happen Again

Public records show a DMV fraud investigations unit helped ICE identify, surveil and detain individuals without warrants.Public records show a DMV fraud investigations unit helped ICE identify, surveil and detain individuals without warrants.

"Thanks to you, Hilda is home again. As Congress begins to discuss immigration policy that already mentions more surveillance and militarization at the border, it's critical we center the demands of border communities and refuse to use them as a bargaining chip.

#revitalizenotmilitarize #nowall

...

Gracias a todos ustedes, Hilda ya regreso a casa! Mientras el congreso empieza a debatir nuevas propuestas migratorias, que ya propongan mas militarizacion y vigilancia en la frontera, es critico que respaldamos a comunidades fronterizas y que no los utlicemos como fichas de negociación."
#freehilda

item.title: At least two dozen inmates have sued the Denver Sheriff...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

At least two dozen inmates have sued the Denver Sheriff Department after they say they were exposed to COVID-19 while incarcerated.

The pro se, federal lawsuits, most filed since the start of the year, are largely handwritten and allege that inmates are not able to socially distance, deputies inside the jail fail to wear masks,…

denverpost.com

Two dozen inmates sue Denver Sheriff Department over alleged COVID-19 exposure

The pro se, federal lawsuits, most filed since the start of the year, are largely handwritten and allege that inmates are not able to socially distance, deputies inside the jail fail to wear masks,…The pro se, federal lawsuits, most filed since the start of the year, are largely handwritten and allege that inmates are not able to socially distance, deputies inside the jail fail to wear masks,…

item.title: Abolish ICE DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - DenverSolidarity with the prisoners at the St. Louis City Justice Center protesting...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Solidarity with the prisoners at the St. Louis City Justice Center protesting deadly conditions and abuses at enormous personal risk!

It is vital that people o...n the outside uplift the struggles of prisoners, fight to advance their demands, and oppose retaliation against them for speaking out. Prisoners report that the facility has been retaliating against participants in protests by deliberately locking them up with COVID-infected inmates!

The demands these prisoners are raising reflect the urgent needs of prisoners and ICE detainees everywhere in the country, including here in Colorado. We call for early and humanitarian release of prisoners and ICE detainees everywhere in the country, safe and humane conditions for all incarcerated people, and an end to retaliation NOW!

See More

item.title: "Three leading Colorado Democratic officials on Monday...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Three leading Colorado Democratic officials on Monday called on the state party to censure U.S. Sen. John Hickenlooper over the Democrat's support on a non-binding vote last week to block undocumented immigrants from receiving pandemic stimulus payments.

Hickenlooper has been under fire for days from furious immigrant-rights advocates and others he can typically count as allies since the lawmaker joined seven other Democratic senators last Thursday night supporting a Republ...

item.title: *Follows in English* En las últimas semanas hemos visto...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

*Follows in English*

En las últimas semanas hemos visto múltiples propuestas de reforma migratoria, entonces, ¿qué significan?¡Qué significan estas propuestas para usted, nuestra comunidad y nuestro trabajo en el futuro! ¡Únase a COPA para hablar sobre las diversas propuestas de reforma migratoria! ¡Nos acompañará la oficina de abogados de Meyer para responder algunas preguntas y hablar sobre las cosas que debe hacer para prepararse! La reunion sera por the aplicación zoom. R...egístrese aquí de antemano para recibir el enlace ➡️ http://bit.ly/Reform2021

*Se proporcionará interpretación al español. Otros idiomas están disponibles a pedido.

In the last couple of weeks we have seen multiple immigration reform proposals, so what do they all mean? What do these proposals mean for you, our community and our work moving forward! Join COPA to talk through the various proposals for immigration reform! We will be joined by the Meyer Law Office to answer some questions and talk about the things you should be doing to prepare! This meeting will be via zoom. Register here before hand to receive the link ➡️ http://bit.ly/Reform2021

*Spanish interpretation will be provided. Other languages are available upon request

See More

HAPPENING NOW

Propuestas de la Reforma Migratoria & Nuestra Comunidad/Immigrant Reform Bills & Our Community

Online Event53 people interested
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: ***Sigue en español*** On February 4th, newly-elected Senator...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

***Sigue en español***

On February 4th, newly-elected Senator John Hickenlooper voted alongside Republicans in favor of an amendment that would deny undocumented immigrants access to federal COVID relief. His vote was for a non-binding amendment, one of hundreds that will guide the actual policy of the bill that will be voted on in the coming weeks. Before that vote happens, we must show Senator Hickenlooper that his stance is unacceptable. Coloradans want COVID relief for ev...eryone. Join us on Tuesday to demand that the senator support stimulus checks for every member of our community.
El 4 de febrero, el senador John Hickenlooper votó junto con los republicanos a favor de una enmienda que negaría a los inmigrantes indocumentados el acceso al alivio federal de COVID. Su voto fue a favor de una enmienda no vinculante, una de las cientos que guiarán la política real del proyecto de ley que se votarán en las próximas semanas. Antes de que ocurra esa votación, debemos mostrarle al senador Hickenlooper que su postura es inaceptable. Los habitantes de Colorado quieren un alivio de COVID para todos. Únete a nosotros el martes para exigir que el senador apoye los cheques de estímulo para cada miembro de nuestra comunidad.

See More

TUE, FEB 9

Car Rally for COVID Relief

2015 Stout St DenverCauses · 113 people
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "Prisoners at the St. Louis City Justice Center have been...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Prisoners at the St. Louis City Justice Center have been protesting since December for safe and humane conditions during the COVID pandemic. They have faced extremely serious retaliation including what appears to be intentional exposure to COVID-infected inmates.

The conditions they are rising up against are shared by prisoners and ICE detainees all across the country. We know full well that these conditions are present in Denver and across the state of Colorado.

Join us Wed...nesday at 5:30pm for a solidarity rally at the Denver City Jail where speakers will share words from inside the St. Louis City Justice Center and insights into the realities inside local jail and prison facilities.

We demand mass humanitarian release of prisoners, safe and humane conditions, and an end to retaliation against prisoners who speak out about abuses and unsafe conditions."

#FreeThemAll

See More

WED, FEB 10

Solidarity with St. Louis & All Prisoners! Rally at Denver City Jail

Denver City JailCauses · 113 people

item.title: "Union del Barrio understands that deportations will not...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Union del Barrio understands that deportations will not stop because Trump is no longer president. We will continue utilizing our community patrols as a tool for fighting back against ICE raids in our San Diego communities. Our patrols have successfully documented and in some cases, halted ICE raids altogether. We will be sharing our thoughts and insight on our community patrols and giving info on how folks can get involved in protecting our people from Migra/police terrorism."

item.title: This New Year’s Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have...
item.content:encoded:
This New Year’s Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have organized a noise demonstration in solidarity with our incarcerated neighbors and political prisoners like anarchist, activist, and poet, Eric King.

What better way is there to show solidarity other than showing up, making some noise & closing out this shit show of a year together? Show up with your best NYE noise makers, demonstration banners and signs. Who knows, we may even try out a new flavor of Pig face? Fed or Jeffco anyone?

We are planning on meeting up at Harriman Lake Park at 7:30 pm at W Quincy Ave & S. Kipling Pkwy, then heading to the facility which is across the street at 9595 W Quincy Ave Littleton, CO 80123.

**Neither we, nor the other organizers of this action, are affiliated in any way with Eric King nor the Eric King Support team @SupportEricKing. We all just want to show some love and and we are happy to signal boost that!**

“I have been incredibly fortunate to have so many people come into my life and take a stand with me so that I didn’t have to face this shit alone… From the smallest greeting to the big gestures, everything has meant so much to me… Now that said, I stand by my actions... After seeing what happened in Ferguson, so close down the road, I was disgusted by the lack of mobilization in my city. Three hours away people were fighting for their lives and we weren’t even taking to the streets. We were doing nothing. My act as a very personal display of my anger and rage toward the state as well as an act of solidarity to everyone in Ferguson. We never know our own strength until we are tested and even with my ridiculous sentence I feel at least proud to have been able to stand strong and refuse to cooperate with the state. I am just really happy that I don’t have to take this alone and have so many amazing people standing next to me. Until all are free.”
— Eric King

https://unicornriot.ninja/2016/eric-king-given-10-yr-sentence-throwing-molotovs-empty-govt-building/
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.” ...
item.content:encoded:
Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.”

“The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the lived experiences of immigrants being held at the GEO detention facility in Aurora, Colorado. This film addresses the personal loss and consequences caused by for-profit detention and the federal government's broken immigration policies. Legal and medical experts highlight horrific abuses including death, medical neglect, nutrition issues, and prolonged detention during the coronavirus pandemic. To tell their stories, current and former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and advocates come together to share their experiences behind the walls of the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

@acluofcolorado @coloradopeoplesalliance @co_immigrant @keshagrijalva @_floodlight_

Following the screening will be a Q&A session with the director, legal experts, and individuals featured in the film with first-hand experience of the systemic abuse occurring inside the facility.

Panelists include:

Jeremy Flood, “The Facility” Director
Raul Medina Perez, COPA, Community Organizer who was formerly detained at GEO
Kesha Davalos Grijalva, Immigrant rights advocate whose husband is detained at GEO
Keinada Andereas, Colorado Student who was formerly detained at GEO
Hans Meyer, The Meyer Law Office, Lead Attorney
Denise Maes, ACLU of Colorado, Public Policy Director

Please RSVP for the screening in advance for this free event: https://aclu.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_nUbTy8-VQpif8nMzqtUzQw

Trailer: https://youtu.be/cGOCejy48Jo

“The Facility” is presented by ACLU of Colorado, Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition, and Colorado Hispanic Bar Association.
